title: An idea...
content:
I was thinking, since re-making all the sprites from keen is such a long and tiring effort, perhaps we should have a thread where every month theres a different tile, and we all contribute in optimizing it (as well as bumping the resolution up by 4 times) and then everyone posts what they did and that gets stored somewhere so we can have a community keen fan game with only the creme of the crop graphics. Good idea?
---------
[img]http://img250.echo.cx/img250/9885/comicstrip9vf.gif[/img]

title: ooh
content: I think it'd be fun.  Wanna post one to start us off with? :-)

title: Re: ooh
content:
I think that would be a lot of fun too. There are just a couple of important points we need to cover first:

1. What kind of style for the tile? Something smooth and gradient-y like Isis or the Keen6 redraw that someone posted a few weeks ago, or a style more bright and cartoony like the originals, but higher res?
I guess every participant could choose what they wanted to do. If we did enough we could have a complete set of each, or partial sets would be cool to. That would still be better than nothing.

2. What do you mean by "4 times the resolution"? Each side would be 4x as long (i.e 8px wide to 32px wide), or would there be 4x as many pixels (8px wide to 16px wide)?

3. Which Keen? Or all of them?

You've got me envisioning a library page of tiles, including, but not limited to, redraws of original Keen tiles. That would be cool, and a big help to anyone wanting to make a fan-game.________________

title: Re: ooh
content: I think I misunderstood somewhere - I assumed alex was talking about where we were going to collaborate and review, rather than store. Unless we except a great enough level of output to merit adding automation to the system, I don't really see the need to add any kind of automation.

title: Re: ooh
content:
This really is a good idea and I'd participate too! One tile per month wouldn't be enough though... let it be 6 to 10 tiles, depending on the enthusiasm of the users, everyone could chose one or two and then we would work together to make the tiles fit. My only fear is that they wouldn't without some consensus about the style. Or do you want the participants to create their own tilesets, adding one tile per month?

Automation is only required if there's a big number of keeners doing it, otherwise the tiles could be just posted on a webpage or even in a topic here.

I'm not at home but I can do the first tile on monday if nobody starts it on this weekend. I hope someone will, otherwise it would mean that there's not enough support for this idea...[hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...
